metadata.title: CVE-2019-9787 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: WordPress before 5.1.1 does not properly filter comment content, leading to Remote Code Execution by unauthenticated users in a default configuration. This occurs because CSRF protection is mishandled, and because Search Engine Optimization of A elements is performed incorrectly, leading to XSS. The XSS results in administrative access, which allows arbitrary changes to .php files. This is related to wp-admin/includes/ajax-actions.php and wp-includes/comment.php.

criterions.comment: wordpress package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.1.1+dfsg1-1').
